Dear Mr. Watkins,
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violation identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Visitation and family time; in person contact
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12421
Section • (4) An agency shall facilitate in-person contact between
Description siblings who are not placed together except when there
is a court determination that contact is detrimental to
either child.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that sibling visits are not occurring.
Investigation The Program Manager was interviewed via telephone on
January 19, 2024, and March 12, 2024. The Program Manager
reported Staff 1, an agency foster care worker, held case
responsibilities from mid- August 2023 until her employment
termination from the agency on November 30, 2023. The Program
Manager reported Staff 1 was not entering documentation and
setting up sibling visits. The Program Manager reported Staff 1
would say sibling visits were occurring when they in fact were not.
The Program Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on
January 19, 2024, and March 11, 12, 2024. The Program
Supervisor reported she was the case manager for the case from
July 2022 until mid-July 2023. The Program Supervisor reported
she was conducting sibling visits until Staff 1 was assigned the
case in October 2023. The Program Supervisor reported she had
concerns about Staff 1 not scheduling sibling visits. The Program
Supervisor acknowledged that sibling visits did not occur when
Staff 1 held the case in October and November 2023. The
Program Supervisor reported she did conduct a sibling visit in
September 2023 but forgot to document the contact.
2

The Guardian Ad Litem was interviewed via telephone on
February 6, 2024, and March 12, 2024. The Guardian Ad Litem
reported Relative 1 had informed her that sibling visits had not
been occurring. The Guardia Ad Litem also reported Relative 1
informed her the Program Supervisor had said to Relative 1, “I
hope you like fucking DHHS”. The Guardian Ad Litem further
reported Relative 1 had said the Program Supervisor had tried to
switch the therapist for Foster Child A.
The Complainant was interviewed via telephone on February
6, 2024.
Relative 1 was interviewed via telephone on February 12,
2024. Relative 1 reported sibling visits between Foster Child A
and her siblings had not occurred from August 2023 until the case
was transferred to DHHS in December 2023.
DOCUMENT REVIEW: The case file for Foster Child A was
reviewed in MISACWIS. Social work contacts were reviewed and
there were no documented sibling visits for September, October,
and November, 2023. The case was transferred to DHHS on
December 15, 2023.
Analysis The Program Manager and Program Supervisor each
acknowledged that sibling visits were not occurring while Staff 1
held responsibility for the case. The Program Supervisor reported
she conducted a sibling visit in September 2023 but had forgotten
to document the visit.
Relative 1 reported sibling visits had not been occurring from
August 2023 until the case was transferred.
Sibling visits for September, October, and November 2023 did not
occur.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section • (2) A staff member must be of responsible character
Description and suitable and able to meet the needs of children and
families served by the agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
3

Allegation It is alleged that a staff person used inappropriate language with a
foster parent.
Investigation During the interview with the Program Supervisor on January 19,
2024, and March 11, 2024, she was informed that an allegation
had been made that she had said to Relative 1, at the time of case
transfer to DHHS, “I hope you enjoy fucking DHHS”. The Program
Supervisor denied she had said this and did admit she said to
Relative 1, “I hope you like working with DHHS”. The Program
Supervisor reiterated that she did not use the term “fucking” at any
time.
During the interview with Relative 1 she reported the Program
Supervisor had said to her, at or around the time of case transfer,
“I hope you like fucking DHHS”. Relative 1 reported there was not
a third party present who would have heard the statement.
Analysis Relative 1 reported the Program Supervisor had made the
comment using profanity.
The Program Supervisor denied she had used profanity in the
statement she had made to Relative 1.
There was not a third party present who could have witnessed the
Program Supervisor using profanity.
Evidence whether the Program Supervisor used inappropriate
language is contradictory.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Development of service plans
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12418
Section • (1) An agency shall develop service plans with the
Description child, the child's parents or legal guardian, the
referring agency, and other parties involved in
providing needed services, or medical care, unless the
agency documents why any of the entities have not
been involved.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that the agency is not following the therapy plan for a
foster child.
Investigation During the interviews with Program Supervisor on January 19,
and March 11, 12, 2024, she reported she had concerns Foster
4

Child A was not receiving therapy from her current therapist for
her inappropriate relationship with an adult male and past sexual
abuse. Foster Child A is receiving therapy at Orchards Childrens
Services. The Program Supervisor reported she had
recommended a change of therapist so the sexual abuse issues
could be addressed. The Program Supervisor made this
recommendation in a Court hearing in September 2023 but could
not remember the exact date of the Court hearing. The Program
Supervisor reported the Guardian Ad Litem on the case disagreed
with the recommendation. The Program Supervisor reported after
the Guardian Ad Litem had disagreed with the recommendation,
she no longer pursued the recommendation to change therapists.
The Program Supervisor reported a change of therapist had not
occurred up to the time the agency no longer had case
responsibility which was on December 15, 2023.
During the interviews with the Guardian Ad Litem on February 5,
and March 12, 2024, she reported she did not agree with the
recommendation to switch therapists for Foster Child A. The
Guardian Ad Litem reported she can’t remember exactly if she
disagreed with the recommendation during a Court hearing but
that she would not have agreed to changing therapists for Foster
Child A.
During the interview with Relative 1 on February 12, 2024, she
reported Foster Child A has been attending therapy with a
therapist at Orchards Children’s Services. Relative 1 reported she
knew the Program Supervisor was concerned that Foster Child A
was not receiving therapy for “certain issues” and wanted a
different therapist who would address the issues of concern.
Relative 1 reported Foster Child A is continuing to see the same
therapist at Orchards and that a change of therapist has not
occurred.
During the second interview with the Program Manager on March
12, 2024, she reported there was a concern Foster Child A was
not receiving therapy for sexual abuse issues and the past
relationship with an adult male. The Program Manager reported
the agency had made a recommendation for a change of therapist
however the Guardian Ad Litem had said no, the therapist will not
be changed. The Program Manager reported a change of
therapists had not occurred up until the time the agency no longer
had case responsibility. The Program Manager reported case
responsibility went to DHHS on December 15, 2023.
5

DOCUMENT REVIEW:
Parent/Agency Treatment Plans: A PATP dated October 19,
2023, documents that Foster Child A is receiving therapy and
there is no documentation which requests a change of therapist.
A PATP dated December 14, 2023, documents that Foster Child A
has had weekly therapy with the same therapist at Orchards
Children’s Services for over a year.
Orchards Children’s Services treatment plan: The document is
not dated but was emailed from the Orchards therapist to the
Program supervisor on August 31, 2023. The document outlines a
therapy plan for Foster Child A.
Analysis The Program Supervisor had made a recommendation for a
change of therapist, but a change had not occurred.
The Program Manager reported she was in agreement with the
recommendation for a change of therapist.
The Guardian Ad Litem reported the Program Supervisor had
recommended a change of therapist and she disagreed with that
recommendation.
Relative 1 reported Foster Child A has been attending therapy
with a therapist at Orchards Childrens Services.
The Program Supervisor only recommended a change of therapist
and a change did not occur.
The agency treatment plan for Foster Child A indicates she has
been attending therapy at Orchards Childrens Services for over a
year.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
